channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Chipotle Debuts First Ghost Kitchen
item.description: Another benefit of ghost kitchens?   In Q3, Chipotle's digital sales soared over 200% yearly to $776 million.   Big picture: Covid-19 has been devastating the restaurant biz. Chipotle's version offers pickup as well.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: We Could Get Used to This: Americans Embrace Remote Work, per Exclusive Morning Brew Polling
item.description: A Morning Brew/Harris poll conducted last weekend found that… Two-thirds (67%) of remote workers say their lifestyle has gotten healthier since working from home. About the same amount (38%) say they've been taking time to cook their meals. This year's social distancing mandates have made employees much more familiar with each other's living rooms.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Next Wave of IPOs Includes DoorDash and Airbnb
item.description: Big picture: As bad as this year has been for procuring dumbbells, it's been quite hospitable to companies going public. It would be one of the biggest U.S. IPOs of the year.   Wish is an e-commerce app that sells ridiculously cheap items.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: November 13
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The Essentials, Issue #81: Stuffing
item.description: Don’t know what to do with yourself on the holiday?   Stay Sharp  Snooze the right way: For all the stomach-sleepers, it’s time to change your sleep habits.   Here’s how to bring your family together while you’re apart.     Happy Place    Busà Photography / Getty Images Ah, Central Park in the fall. Leading Off    Giphy The best parts of Thanksgiving: mashed sweet potatoes with toasted marshmallows on top (golden, not burnt); the acceptable midday nap; and the leftovers.   Dept.   If you’re sick of cooking already, these Thanksgiving foods ship nationwide.   Keep it simple and gobble up a Thanksgiving-themed sheet-pan meal.   R&R   LauriPatterson / Getty Images Spoonful of sugar: Whether you’re a lazy baker, a procrasti-baker, or a Martha Stewart in the making, whisk your way through this list of easy baking recipes with five ingredients or fewer. Your Thanksgiving dinner may not have as many chairs or as big a dessert table this year, but we’ve got a few ideas to make your Thanksgiving takeout and outdoor celebration a little bit better. Now she’s inspiring scientific research.
item.author: Rachel Cantor

item.title: The Masters Returns...in November
item.description: The Masters golf tournament tees off today at Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia. Tony Finau. The Brew's pick? $3 for a chicken wrap! That means we'll have to accept fall foliage in place of flowering azaleas.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Facebook and Google Extend Their Broad Sweeping Bans on Political Ads
item.description: Bottom line: Critics argue the ad ban doesn’t address the real issue afflicting social media—the spread of misinformation in unpaid, organic posts. Much like we had planned to always wear pants while working, Facebook and Google had planned to lift their bans on political advertising one week after the election concluded.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: TikTok Complains U.S. Government Went Silent on Divestiture Deadline
item.description: Now, TikTok owner ByteDance says the U.S. government left it on read. Chinese-owned video sharing giant TikTok, whose potential sale dominated the news over the summer, returned to the headlines with a court petition filed on Tuesday. to warmer months. On Thursdays, we throw back...
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Disney+ Turns 1: How’d It Do?
item.description: Y/N   + Flash poll: Is Baby Yoda cute? while the pandemic delayed production timelines, Disney+ expects to release more original content next year, including—what else—more Marvel and Star Wars series.   Looking ahead...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Sony and Microsoft Take Different Approaches in Their Latest Console War
item.description: With the launch of the Sony PlayStation 5 today and Microsoft’s Xbox Series X and S on Tuesday, this week marks harmonic convergence of the console giants all over again—an endless cycle of hyped hardware releases that occurs every eight-ish years. Sony continues to be the hardware leader for die-hard gamers. P.S. Neither Sony nor Microsoft is expected to sell the most consoles this holiday season. A new offering called “All Access” lets gamers pay for the new Xbox in monthly installments, and—here’s the kicker—also signs them up for Xbox’s Netflix-like Game Pass Ultimate gaming subscription service.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The Masters Returns...in November
item.description: The Masters golf tournament tees off today at Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Virtual Events Startup Hopin Vaults Past $2 Billion Valuation
item.description: Then Covid-19 arrived and so did blazing-fast growth.   Hopin also says it's profitable, with annual recurring revenue of $20 million. But Hopin's betting it can find a foothold in a post-Covid economy with "hybrid" events. Users?
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Fed Governor Lael Brainard Rumored Frontrunner for Biden Treasury
item.description: If she isn't...   If picked... other folks reportedly under consideration include Ariel Investments co-CEO Mellody Hobson, Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic, and Powell's predecessor, Janet Yellen.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Singles Day to Test China's Consumer Demand
item.description: Big picture: The pandemic pushed more Chinese consumers to e-commerce, and Singles Day will provide more intel on the health of the Chinese economy.   Alibaba kicked sales off a little early this year, and as of 12:30am local time, consumers spent $56.3 billion on its Taobao and Tmall e-commerce platforms.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Apple Breaks Up With Intel With New Hardware Featuring Internally Created Chips
item.description: Now for the fun, shiny things: The new hardware includes a super-thin MacBook Air, a new MacBook Pro with juiced-up battery life, and a Mac Mini desktop.     The new Big Sur OS also drops today.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: New Study Indicates Crowded Indoor Spaces Are Ripe for Covid Transmission
item.description: These researchers argue that probably won't be necessary, because limiting capacity at indoor venues can meaningfully contain the spread of the virus—when paired with critical precautions like social distancing and wearing masks.   On the other hand, reopening indoor businesses at full capacity = recipe for superspreading. Not only were they less likely to work from home, but also the indoor venues they visited were more crowded.   Quick note on methodology: Using anonymized smartphone data, the researchers tracked the movements of 98 million people in 10 U.S. metros from March to May—the first wave of the virus.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Singles Day to Test China's Consumer Demand
item.description: Big picture: The pandemic pushed more Chinese consumers to e-commerce, and Singles Day will provide more intel on the health of the Chinese economy.   Alibaba kicked sales off a little early this year, and as of 12:30am local time, consumers spent $56.3 billion on its Taobao and Tmall e-commerce platforms.

item.description: If she isn't...   If picked... other folks reportedly under consideration include Ariel Investments co-CEO Mellody Hobson, Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic, and Powell's predecessor, Janet Yellen.

item.title: McDonald's Announces Plant-Based Meat Line, McPlant
item.description: McDonald's will join rivals like Burger King (Impossible Whopper) and Dunkin' (Beyond Sausage) in changing its menu to match increased consumer demand for veggie alternatives.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Supreme Court Hears Arguments to Decide Fate of the ACA
item.description: A federal district judge agreed, it got appealed, and now the defendants (20 blue states led by California) want the Supreme Court to step in.   Will they?
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Pfizer's Vaccine News Has Investors Eyeing a Future With the Coronavirus Under Control
item.description: Zoom out: While Pfizer's vaccine appears to speed up timelines, there's still a ways to go before we control the pandemic and any of these violent intraday swings solidify into long-term trends.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Pfizer's Covid-19 Vaccine Posts Promising Results
item.description: The trial: Over a three-week period, researchers administered two vaccine doses to 43,538 volunteers; around half received the vaccine, the other half placebos. Yesterday morning, Pfizer said its Covid-19 vaccine was over 90% effective in late-stage clinical trials.   Next steps The FDA needs follow-up data to make sure Pfizer's vaccine isn't making participants grow tails.   If it gets it, Pfizer says it can produce 50 million doses by the end of 2020 and 1.3 billion in 2021.   We don't know if the vaccine prevents asymptomatic transmission or severe Covid cases that cause hospitalization. And an effective vaccine can't come fast enough. Pfizer's product is harder to move around than an octopus ice sculpture.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: McDonald's Announces Plant-Based Meat Line, McPlant
item.description: Last winter, it ran a test in Canada with plant-based company Beyond Meat, and Beyond said it co-created the McPlant patty with McDonald's.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Pfizer's Covid-19 Vaccine Posts Promising Results
item.description: The trial: Over a three-week period, researchers administered two vaccine doses to 43,538 volunteers; around half received the vaccine, the other half placebos. Yesterday morning, Pfizer said its Covid-19 vaccine was over 90% effective in late-stage clinical trials.   If it gets it, Pfizer says it can produce 50 million doses by the end of 2020 and 1.3 billion in 2021.   Next steps The FDA needs follow-up data to make sure Pfizer's vaccine isn't making participants grow tails.   We don't know if the vaccine prevents asymptomatic transmission or severe Covid cases that cause hospitalization. And an effective vaccine can't come fast enough. Pfizer's product is harder to move around than an octopus ice sculpture.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Supreme Court Hears Arguments to Decide Fate of the ACA
item.description: Will they?   A federal district judge agreed, it got appealed, and now the defendants (20 blue states led by California) want the Court to step in.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Pfizer's Vaccine News Has Investors Eyeing a Future With the Coronavirus Under Control
item.description: And the vaccine news paired with the upcoming Thanksgiving travel season like a fine wine to send the airline exchange-traded fund, JETS, soaring 16%. Peloton (-20%), Zoom (-17%), Etsy (-17%), and Clorox (-11%), all companies that benefited from the sweeping social changes brought on by the pandemic, came crashing down. Some didn't take it as well...
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Fashion Brand Supreme Rides Digital Excellence, Cult Following to $2.1 Billion Acquisition
item.description: Supreme, which does 60% of its sales online, will play a key role in what VF CEO Steve Rendle calls a "hyper-digital business model transformation."   What that $2.1 billion is getting: Supreme is not your typical multi-billion dollar brand with a scant brick-and-mortar footprint and limited distribution.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: The Essentials, Issue #80: Joy triggers
item.description: .   Some great Jeopardy!   Happy Place    Andras Szada / EyeEm / Getty Images This week’s Happy Place is brought to you by Essentials reader Erin S.    Can you get all 50 of the easiest Jeopardy! Leading Off    Giphy Who is the greatest game show host of all time?   Dept.   R&R   Jennifer A Smith / Getty Images Not sourdough: As a smol girl in a big bread-baking world, I occasionally dabble in everyone’s most-loved quarantine hobby.      The GOAT: Daily pics of cute baby goats.   Dress the part: If you’re already over the sweatpants phase, get some style inspo from these top men’s fashion TikTokers.   Stay Sharp Take a chill pill: Now that the election is over, we can all just breathe. Or maybe that’s just me.   Travel cross country: Escape to nature and learn to camp for free from two adventure-seeking experts.    Chad Haupt: a true gentleman bringing you practical fashion tips and tricks.    Fresh produce: Here’s your guide to roasting any veggie. questions?   Stew szn: Which soup should I make this week?
item.author: Rachel Cantor

item.title: Week Ahead: November 9
item.description: Monday: Earnings (McDonald’s, SoftBank, Beyond Meat) Tuesday: Microsoft launches the new Xbox; Apple’s “One More Thing” event  Wednesday: Veterans Day; the country’s National Parks have free admission  Thursday: Consumer price index inflation data; The Masters begins; Sony launches PlayStation 5; earnings (Palantir, Disney)   Friday: the 13th
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Why Ant’s IPO Got Squashed
item.description: Overshadowed by, you know, everything last week was the stunning collapse of Ant Group’s IPO.   But Jack Ma decided to speak up. Why it matters: Ma’s comments reflected the tense relationship between China’s growing fintech sector and the traditional financial system.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: As FLOTUS, Dr. Jill Biden Will Champion Educators
item.description: That means education is going to be at the top of her agenda.   We should also mention Doug  Doug Emhoff, to be specific—VP-elect Kamala Harris’s husband. He’ll be the first male spouse of any vice president or president.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Election Aftermath: What Else You Need to Know
item.description: Day 1: Here are a few stories explaining what Biden’s promised to do on his first day in office.   The cabinet: The level of speculation over who Biden will tap for his cabinet posts rivals NBA free agency, and the Treasury could be the first and nastiest fight.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Businesses Look Towards a Future Under Biden
item.description: Biden’s said he can’t end the pandemic by “flipping a switch,” but biz leaders hope a more hands-on approach compared to President Trump’s can lead to a quicker economic recovery.   Here are the six things biz leaders want from Biden. No tax hike: Biden has pledged to raise the corporate tax rate, which businesses no-likey. Boringness: Whereas President Trump’s policies fostered a mostly favorable corporate environment, it came with a lot of baggage." Improve trade relations: During his tenure as president, President Trump launched a trade war with China and got into bitter scuffles with longstanding economic partners like the EU.
item.author: Toby Howell
